[Page Title: Virginia's On King - Holy City Hospitality]

Make a Reservation View Menus Join Our Loyalty Program 
Charleston Southern Hospitality

Virginia‚Äôs on King is a sophisticated Southern restaurant blending traditional kitchen comforts with familiar regional dishes. Prepared with the utmost care for quality and flavor, the menu incorporates local ingredients and family recipes to bring you Southern cooking Lowcountry style. Classic Charleston style and homecooked aromas inspire the ambiance of this local favorite. At the heart of Virginia‚Äôs, you will find gracious Southern hospitality and comfort foods that make you feel right at home.

Contact us at 843-725-5959 ext 1 or through the link below

Follow Us

Private Events

The Upstairs at Virginia‚Äôs dining room is completely separated from the downstairs dining room. Purposely designed to host small receptions, corporate events, rehearsal dinners and bridal luncheons, Upstairs at Virginia‚Äôs is your ideal local for your special occasion!

Classic Charleston influenced interior and the aromas of home cooking inspire all of the comforts of a traditional Southern kitchen, the perfect setting for hosting any of your events. At the heart of Virginia‚Äôs you will find gracious southern hospitality along with all of the flavors of the Lowcountry.

[Page Title: Coast Bar And Grill - Holy City Hospitality]

Make a Reservation View Menus Join Our Loyalty Program 
Charleston‚Äôs Freshest Seafood

Located in a historic warehouse, Coast Bar and Grill features 40-foot ceilings, rustic tin roofs and art from around the world, creating an atmosphere reminiscent of an eclectic beach bar.

Our chefs are dedicated to procuring the freshest seafood from the Charleston shores and around the Lowcountry. Served nightly, our menu offers seafood classics along with the chefs‚Äô nightly unique creations. At the heart of Coast Bar and Grill is the hickory and oak custom wood-burning grill, a feature you will only find at Coast.

Guests‚Äô favorites include our daily selection of oysters and wood-grilled fish paired with our freshly made in-house sauces; there‚Äôs an option for everyone‚Äôs palate. Here at Coast Bar and Grill, we are dedicated to making every effort to create an unique experience with only the highest quality of ingredients.

Follow Us

Private Events

Coast is available for daytime events such as conferences or luncheons and semi-private evening gatherings.

The patio at Coast seats 25 comfortably, ideal for semi-private celebrations.
The dining room is an ideal space for meetings and luncheons.
Private evening gatherings of varying sizes can be hosted Upstairs at 39 Rue de Jean.

All event spaces provide menus designed to your specific needs. Let our professionals tailor your special event and make the most of it.

[Page Title: 39 Rue de Jean - Holy City Hospitality]

Make a Reservation View Menus Join Our Loyalty Program 
Offering the Best Brasserie Cuisine in Charleston

39 Rue de Jean is a refined French Cafe and Bar reminiscent of a late 1800‚Äôs Brasserie. Our menu features Parisian-inspired classics, custom cocktails, and a tailored selection of wines. You will feel as though you are in a traditional French Brasserie when you dine at Rue de Jean, with a neighborhood feel that will transport you to Paris! 39 Rue de Jean offers robust selections, with hearty classics and lighter fare, as well as elegant craft cocktails, an extensive wine and beer list, and jubilant socializing.

Contact us at 843-725-5959 ext 1 or through the link below

Follow Us

Private Events

The Upstairs at Rue event space offers a private dining room that can be transformed to host professional gatherings or celebratory affairs, accommodating up to 200 guests. This unique space, overlooking Upper King street, features vaulted ceilings, exposed brick and a private entrance.

[Page Title: Vincent Chiccos - Holy City Hospitality]

Make a Reservation View Menus Join Our Loyalty Program 
Classic Italian with a Modern Touch

Vincent Chicco‚Äôs, like its namesake, history and tradition is what shapes this modern take on classic Italian-American fare. Tucked along Hutson Alley, Chicco‚Äôs is a serene hideaway offering refined Italian cuisine with fresh ingredients, handmade pastas and house made sauces.

During the prohibition era, Vinent Chicco who emigrated to Charleston from Italy, ran a number of saloons and led the fight locally against prohibition. Chicco‚Äôs arrest was the first after a dispensary law was passed by Governor Tillman. Chicco‚Äôs arrest became infamous as many Charlestonians opposed this law. Today, Vincent Chicco‚Äôs is proud to serve elevated old-world classic Italian cuisine beholden to one of Charleston‚Äôs heroes from a lost time.

Contact us at 843-725-5959 ext 1 or through the link below

Follow Us

Private Events

Vincent Chicco‚Äôs private dining room can be transformed to host up to 100 guests for a professional gathering or celebratory affair. This unique space above our Italian restaurant in the heart of upper King Street in downtown Charleston features vaulted ceilings, exposed brick and sophisticated elegance.

[Page Title: Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar - Holy City Hospitality]

View Menu Join Our Loyalty Program 
Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar

Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar is nestled between 39 Rue de Jean and Coast Bar & Grill on beautiful Hutson Alley. With only 4 barstools inside, but plenty of additional seating outside on the alley, it‚Äôs the perfect spot to grab a drink before dinner or before a show next door at Charleston Music Hall. Small bites are available from Coast, including fried shrimp, crab dip, and oysters on the 1/2 shell.

The bar features a variety of canned cocktails, beer and wine. There are 2 frozen drinks available: BCheerwine Slushie and our very own creation, Hutson Alley Hooch.

[Page Title: Events - Holy City Hospitality]

Events

39 Rue de Jean Celebrates 25 Years of French-Inspired Dining in Charleston

A year-long celebration featuring wine dinners, guest nostalgia, special events, and the return of daily lunch service
39 Rue de Jean, the beloved French brasserie that helped define Charleston‚Äôs culinary identity, is celebrating 25 years in 2026 ‚Äî and inviting the community to join in a year-long f√™te filled with flavor, nostalgia, and joie de vivre. Since opening its doors in 2001, 39 Rue de Jean has become a cornerstone of Charleston dining culture. From its classic French fare to its lively bar scene and timeless brasserie charm, ‚ÄúRue‚Äù has welcomed generations of locals, visitors, families, and industry friends. Now, in honor of a remarkable 25 years, the restaurant is rolling out a full calendar of celebrations designed to toast the past ‚Äî and raise a glass to the next chapter. 
Throughout 2026, guests can expect:
‚ú® Monthly Wine Dinners ‚Äì Each month will feature a themed wine dinner spotlighting French regions, Rue de Jean favorites, and guest chef collaborations. Reservations will be limited for an intimate, elevated experience. üì∏ ‚ÄúRue Memories‚Äù Social Media Campaign ‚Äì Guests are invited to share their favorite photos, stories, and memories from visits over the last 25 years. Submissions will be featured on Rue‚Äôs social channels ‚Äî with giveaways and the chance to be highlighted in a commemorative end-of-year project. ü•Ç A Bubbles Bell ‚Äì Installed in the dining room, the Bubbles Bell will be rung at surprise moments throughout the year. When it rings, the entire restaurant will celebrate with a complimentary glass of bubbles ‚Äî including non-alcoholic options ‚Äî as a toast to 25 years of Rue de Jean and 25 more to come. üéâ F√™te de la Rue ‚Äî April 2026 ‚Äì This ticketed patio celebration will take over the restaurant‚Äôs patio and surrounding spaces for an afternoon of French street-festival magic: food and wine stations, live entertainment, specialty cocktails, and celebratory surprises. Mark your calendars for April 25th, tickets will go on sale in early March. üçΩ The Return of Lunch ‚Äì In honor of the anniversary, lunch service returns seven days a week beginning January 12th , complete with a refreshed menu featuring guest-requested throwback dishes, modern French plates, and new seasonal offerings. Charleston is invited to celebrate the past, savor the present, and toast to the future ‚Äî one glass of bubbles at a time. Merci, Charleston! 
Holidays on Hutson
December 4th - 22nd 
Starting December 4th, Hutson Alley transforms into Charleston‚Äôs must-see holiday destination! Step into a winter wonderland in the heart of downtown and enjoy festive experiences for all ages.

‚ú® at 5pm & 7pm‚òï from Charleston‚Äôs Smallest BarüõçÔ∏è every Thursday‚ÄìSaturday from 5pm‚Äì8pmüî• available from Charleston‚Äôs Smallest BarüéÖ on December 16, 18, and 20 from 5pm‚Äì7pmüì∏ for picture-perfect memoriesüç∏ available at all HCH restaurantsüëßüßí all December at Vincent Chicco‚Äôs and Victor‚Äôs Seafood & Steak
Daily Snowfall Complimentary Hot Chocolate Holiday Market Vendors S‚Äômores Kits Santa & Mrs. Claus Appearances Multiple Holiday Photo Ops Seasonal Cocktails Kids Eat Free 
Come celebrate the magic of the season in the coziest corner of Charleston.

Taste of Hutson Alley
Wednesday, November 19th Your favorite event from Charleston‚Äôs Best Hospitality Group is back ‚Äî and this year, it‚Äôs bigger, brighter, and more meaningful than ever. Join Holy City Hospitality on Wednesday, November 19th, for an unforgettable evening under the lanterns and string lights of beautiful Hutson Alley. Guests will enter through the John Street gate and be welcomed with a seasonal signature cocktail featuring Angels Envy from Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar, setting the tone for an evening of local flavor and festive cheer. Throughout the alley, enjoy chef-attended tasting stations from all six Holy City Hospitality restaurants, along with decadent desserts from Good Food Catering. Sip and savor your way through the night with a Don Gato Tequila signature drink, bourbon tastings to inspire your holiday entertaining, craft beer from Southern Crown, fine wines, and live music by Ronnie Johnson. This year‚Äôs event is also about giving back. A portion of all ticket sales will benefit the Lowcountry Food Bank, and guests are encouraged to bring non-perishable food donations to help support local families in need this holiday season. Celebrate community, cuisine, and the spirit of Charleston ‚Äî all in one magical night. Tickets are limited, so early purchase is encouraged to reserve your spot. Purchase tickets here Get Tickets Here

Oak & Smoke
October 16th, 6pm-10pm Victor‚Äôs Seafood & Steak Presents Oak & Smoke: An Evening of Bourbon, Cigars, and Culinary Indulgence on Hutson Alley Charleston, SC ‚Äî August 27, 2025 ‚Äî Victor‚Äôs Seafood & Steak is teaming up with The Dropping Pin and Smokin‚Äô Rose Speakeasy to bring Charleston an unforgettable evening of refined flavors, premium, hand-rolled cigars, and live entertainment. Oak & Smoke will take place at Victor‚Äôs Seafood & Steak on October 16th from 6pm-10pm, and promises an unforgettable blend of flavor, craftsmanship, and camaraderie. Guests will experience the warm glow of soft lighting, the aroma of premium cigars, and the refined notes of small-batch bourbons, all complemented by chef-driven coastal cuisine. Guiding the culinary experience is Executive Chef Dean Szablewski , who will present an array of elevated bites throughout the evening, including a fresh oyster on the half shell station , an abundant grazing table , and an assortment of passed appetizers designed to complement the evening‚Äôs bourbon and cigar pairings. Victor‚Äôs Seafood & Steak‚Äôs full dinner menu will also be available for purchase. Live entertainment will set the tone with the smooth, sultry sounds of saxophonist Cosmo followed by the vibrant beats of Deejay Sam-Well , creating the perfect soundtrack for an evening of sophistication and connection. Ticket options will be available in three tiers, for those who love the social aspect to those who want a more all inclusive experience. Early bird pricing for all 3 tiers is available now through September 10th. For questions, please reach out to [email¬†protected] Get Tickets Here 
Hutson Alley Derby Affair
May 3rd, 4:30pm-7:30pm Hutson Alley Hosts Derby Party with Mint Juleps, Hors d‚ÄôOeuvres & Racing Fun Charleston, SC ‚Äì Get ready to don your finest hats and bow ties as Hutson Alley transforms into the ultimate Derby Day celebration! On Saturday, May 3rd, from 4:30 to 7:30 PM , guests are invited to experience an unforgettable Kentucky Derby Party featuring live race action, festive cocktails highlighting local spirits from Firefly Distillery, and Southern-inspired bites from Coast Bar & Grill . This exclusive $30 ticketed event includes: One welcome Mint Julep featuring Live Straight Bourbon Whiskey from Firefly Distillery to kick off the festivities, heavy passed ‚ÄúHorse‚Äù d‚ÄôOeuvres crafted by Coast Bar & Grill, One Raffle Ticket for a chance to win exciting prizes, plus Best Hat, Best Dressed Duo & Best Bow Tie Contests Guests can sip on mint juleps and other Derby-inspired cocktails while enjoying the live race broadcast on the Coast patio . Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned racing fan or just here for the fashion and fun, this event is your perfect way to celebrate the ‚ÄúRun for the Roses‚Äù in true Southern style. Coast Bar and Grill and Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar will be open for additional food and drink purchases. Tickets are limited‚Äî don‚Äôt miss your chance to join Charleston‚Äôs most stylish Derby celebration! For questions, please reach out to [email¬†protected] Get Tickets Here 
Hutson Alley's Big Fat Tuesday
March 4th, 5:30pm-8:30pm Get ready to let the good times roll! Coast Bar & Grill is bringing the vibrant energy of New Orleans to Hutson Alley in downtown Charleston with an unforgettable Big Fat Tuesday Crawfish Boil & Mardi Gras Party on Tuesday, March 4th . Join us as we celebrate Mardi Gras in true Louisiana style with a traditional crawfish boil, festive cocktails, and laissez les bon temps rouler. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned crawfish connoisseur or just looking for a taste of authentic Cajun flavors, this is one party you won‚Äôt want to miss. Tickets include our AYCE crawfish boil and 3 drink tickets. Bacardi will be on-site with Mardi Gras inspired cocktails and souvenir swag to keep the good times rolling! Doors open at 5:30, and the party lasts until 8:30. Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar and Coast Bar & Grill will be open for additional food and beverage purchases. For questions, please reach out to [email¬†protected] Get Tickets Here

Your favorite event from Charleston‚Äôs Best Hospitality Group is BACK! Mark your calendars for Wednesday, November 20th! Guests will be greeted at the John St. entrance to Hutson Alley with a seasonal welcome beverage from Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar.¬† The evening‚Äôs celebration will take place among the lanterns and under the lights of our beautiful alleyway with chef-attended stations from all six Holy City Hospitality restaurants and dessert samplings from Good Food Catering. Attendees are welcome to enjoy a specialty cocktail offering, craft beer, wines from Republic National Distributing Company (RNDC), and live music from Ronnie Johnson. Tickets are limited, so early purchase is encouraged to reserve your spot. Get Tickets Here 
GFC New Venue

This new property has been experiencing a minor identity crisis, prompting us to host a naming party last week. We appreciate everyone who came out and for your valuable input. We are so excited about this new location, for the future, and for the endless possibilities this venue holds!

Stay tuned as we unveil the chosen name and provide further details. Your continued support and interest are highly appreciated.

Bouquets & Ros√©
June 10th, 3-5pm 
Spring is in the air and we are planning how to celebrate our favorite holiday‚ÄìNational Ros√© Day on Saturday June 10th! Come join us at Victor‚Äôs Seafood & Steak for Bouquets & Ros√©! This event promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering the perfect combination of delectable wine and beautiful customizable floral arrangements.

Bouquets & Ros√© is the perfect opportunity to savor a variety of ros√©s and learn the art of bouquet making from the experts at Boone‚Äôs Blooms. With their expert guidance, you‚Äôll create a stunning bouquet of flowers to take home and enjoy long after the event is over.

Tickets include small bites, ros√© flights and your bouquet to take home and enjoy! On sale at ‚Äî $80 for early purchase and $90 for regular sale.

Whether you‚Äôre a ros√© lover or just looking for a fun and unique afternoon, this event is the perfect opportunity. The beautiful ambiance of Hutson Alley and Victor‚Äôs, along with the floral expertise of our friends with Boone‚Äôs Blooms makes this an event not to miss this spring!
Buy Tickets 
Pup Party on the Alley
May 7th, 12-3pm 
Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar and Pet Helpers have teamed up throw ‚ÄúPup Party on the Alley‚Äù. Join us for a pawsome event centered around dog adoption and a pet supplies drive! This event is designed to bring together animal lovers and enthusiasts to help local dogs in need.

This event will be held on Sunday May 7th from 12-3pm outside of Charleston‚Äôs Smallest bar on Hutson Alley (39 John St.). All are welcome, especially your fur babies!

We will have specials on food and drinks available‚Äìfor you and your pup. We will also be handing out prizes for the best boys and girls for things like, ‚Äúbest trick‚Äù and ‚Äúbest puppy dog eyes‚Äù

Don‚Äôt miss out on this chance to make a difference in the lives of dogs in need. Mark your calendar and come out to support this wonderful cause!

March 15th, 2023 
Cornament?? Courney?? You can call it whatever you want because we‚Äôre hosting our 1st ever Cornhole Tournament at Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar! Certified SC returns to Marion Square with a tent featuring the Palmetto State‚Äôs finest specialty food vendors and the Fresh on the Menu cooking stage, where South Carolina‚Äôs most talented chefs team up with their favorite farmers for a weekend of demonstrations and tastings showing why South Carolina is one of the best states in the nation for food-lovers.

Dry January Dinner with Spiritless Cocktails
Jan 19 & 24th, 2023 39 Rue de Jean is excited to host a 4-course dinner on January 19th, partnering with Spiritless Cocktails. January is the perfect month for a reset for those who choose to cut back on alcohol consumption after holiday indulgences. This dinner will feature 4 courses, paired with 5 alcohol-free cocktails from Spiritless. 
Representatives from Spiritless will be hosting this dinner alongside the Rue de Jean team, and will be there to answer any questions, and offer suggestions to those hoping to maintain or experiment with a ‚Äúdry‚Äù or ‚Äúdamp‚Äù lifestyle.

Midnight at the Rice Mill
Dec 31, 2022 
Historic Rice Mill is excited to once again host Midnight at The Rice Mill. The event will be complete with music from DJ Moo Moo, delicious cuisine from Good Food Catering, an all inclusive bar, a 360¬∞ photo booth, and a midnight champagne toast. Dance the night away and ring in the New Year at the Historic Rice Mill overlooking the Ashley River and enjoy an upscale, celebratory affair.

Restaurant Week
Jan 12 - 22, 2023 
All Holy City Hospitality locations participate in restaurant week. The Chefs get the opportunity to create a unique coursed menu which allows guests to get a taste of what each restaurant has to offer!

Taste of Hutson Alley Recap 2022

It had been too long since our event on the Alley! Our November event was centered on giving our chef‚Äôs from each restaurant the opportunity to show off their creations. The celebration took place among the lanterns and under the lights of our beautiful alleyway with chef-attended stations from all six Holy City Hospitality restaurants and dessert samplings from Good Food Catering.Guests were greeted at the John St. entrance to Hutson Alley and offered samples of Charleston‚Äôs Smallest Bar‚Äôs Hutson Alley Hooch. Attendees were welcome to enjoy a specialty cocktail featuring Tasmanian Pure Vodka, craft beer from Commonhouse Aleworks, wine from Republic National Distributing Company (RNDC), and live music from Ronnie Johnson. Despite the chill, guests danced under the lights to classics performed by Johnson. As well, many were huddled inside on the plush couches in Victor‚Äôs.
